data.name: ACCAndActiveDirectory
data.value: AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) and Directory

data.name: ACCAndActiveDirectoryDescription
data.value: Allow AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) services to securely access your company’s corporate resourses without exposing your network. Create a secure connection to your Active Directory (AD) to import users and groups from your company’s directory.

data.name: ACCInstallerDownloaded
data.value: AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) Installer Downloaded

data.name: ACCSetup
data.value: AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) Setup

data.name: ACCSetupDetailsArg
data.value: Follow these simple steps to enable AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) to securely access your organization’s corporate resources without requiring changes to your network firewall. A list of hardware and software requirements and additional information about Change to AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) architecture is located {0}.

data.name: ActiveDirectoryBasicDescription
data.value: Active Directory (Basic) will support a single directory configured only at the top-level customer Organization Group. Enable to synchronize users to Workspace ONE Access without having to install Workspace ONE Access Connector. Not recommended for large, complex enterprise deployments.

data.name: AirWatchCloudConnectorWithAbbreviation
data.value: AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC)

data.name: AndroidAppsPermissionAutoApproved
data.value: Android apps and any associated permissions will be automatically approved and updated in your Google Play Store account.

data.name: CompleteConnectToVIDMStep
data.value: Configure Workspace ONE Access to unlock.

data.name: ConfigureAd
data.value: Use the forms below to give AirWatch access to your Active Directory, then begin importing users.

data.name: ConfiguredSuccessfully
data.value: Configured Successfully

data.name: ConnectorAndDirectoryOverviewDescription1
data.value: Once a connector has been configured, it will create an outbound-only connection to Workspace ONE. This wizard will help you:

data.name: ConnectorAndDirectoryOverviewDescription2
data.value: Install and configure a connector package for AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC)

data.name: ConnectorAndDirectoryOverviewDescription3
data.value: Deploy connectors to synchronize Workspace ONE UEM with your AD

data.name: ConnectorAndDirectoryOverviewDescription4
data.value: Go to the {0} console to deploy connectors that synchronize Workspace ONE Access with your AD (strongly recommended).

data.name: ConnectorAndDirectoryOverviewHeader
data.value: To give enterprise users access to Workspace ONE, a connection between Workspace ONE UEM and your Active Directory (AD) in your internal network must first be established.

data.name: ConnectorAndDirectoryOverviewImageDescription
data.value: AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) services help you synchronize your Active Directory with its respective service independently. This wizard helps you configure the connection between Workspace ONE UEM and your AD only.

data.name: ConnectorAndDirectoryOverviewNote
data.value: Note: Connectors are required for on-premises installations where Workspace ONE services are deployed in DMZ. Connector configurations are required in order for SaaS deployments to communicate with your AD. See the {0} for more details.

data.name: ConnectToIdentityManagerDescription
data.value: Allow Workspace ONE UEM to communicate with Workspace ONE Access to deploy identity-driven features such as a unified catalog, Mobile SSO, and device trust.

data.name: Credentials
data.value: Credentials

data.name: DeleteConfiguration
data.value: Delete Configuration

data.name: DeleteVidmConfiguration
data.value: Delete Workspace ONE Access Configuration

data.name: DeleteVidmDescription
data.value: This action will remove all communication between Workspace ONE Access and Workspace ONE UEM. This will prevent features such as the unified catalog and the device compliance authentication adapter from functioning until re-enabled.

data.name: DeploymentGuide
data.value: Deployment Guide

data.name: DeviceEnrollment
data.value: Device Enrollment

data.name: DownloadACCInstaller
data.value: Download AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) Installer

data.name: DownloadACCInstallerDescription
data.value: Create a password for your AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) certificate below. You will need your certificate password when you launch the AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) installer in the next step.

data.name: EmployeeEmailTemplateDescription
data.value: Download an email template to introduce employees to Workspace ONE and how to get started.

data.name: EnableGettingStartedDescription
data.value: Getting Started is an easy way to be guided through the setup steps you need to complete. Would you like to enable it now?

data.name: FailedToEnableDirectoryAuthentication
data.value: Failed to enable Directory Authentication

data.name: FailedToSetWorkspaceOneMode
data.value: It appears an error occurred updating the Worskpace ONE Catalog mode on Workspace ONE Access. Please check this field in Workspace ONE Access and try again to continue.

data.name: FollowStepsToCompleteAccInstallation
data.value: Follow the steps below to complete your the AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) installation.

data.name: ForMoreInformation
data.value: {0|Click here} for more information.

data.name: GettingStartedNotEnabled
data.value: Getting Started is not enabled.

data.name: IdentityAndAccessManagement
data.value: Identity And Access Management

data.name: InstallAcc
data.value: Install AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC).

data.name: InvalidStagedDataPleaseReinitiateVidmConfiguration
data.value: Invalid staged data. Please re-initiate the Workspace ONE Access configuration.

data.name: NextStepsDescription1
data.value: To activate Workspace ONE Access Connector and synchronize Active Directory with Workspace ONE Access, go to {0} to download the installation package and then follow the steps below

data.name: NextStepsDescription2
data.value: Synchronizing Workspace ONE UEM and Workspace ONE Access with Active Directory enables identity-driven features such as Mobile SSO, conditional access, federated applications and more

data.name: NextStepsDescription3
data.value: Navigate to {0|Workspace ONE Access} and click ‘Add Connector’ to get an activation string

data.name: NextStepsDescription4
data.value: Input the activation string on the Workspace ONE Access connector

data.name: NextStepsDescription5
data.value: Configure active directory in the Workspace ONE Access admin console. Reminder: It’s recommended to configure the same user and group sync settings for Workspace ONE Access as were configured for Workspace ONE UEM in the wizard.

data.name: NextStepsDescription6
data.value: The Workspace ONE Access Connector synchronizes your Active Directory users and groups with Workspace ONE Access and supports outbound-only mode for synchronization, requiring no inbound ports to your company network.

data.name: NextStepsHeader
data.value: Next Steps:

data.name: NextStepsStronglyRecommend
data.value: Next Steps (Strongly Recommended)

data.name: OptionOfAddingAppsFromPublicAppsPage
data.value: You also have the option of adding apps from the Public Apps page to view permissions and approve manually.

data.name: PasswordForAccCertificate
data.value: Password for the AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) certificate. You will need this to import the settings to a AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) server.

data.name: RequireGroupIdForVidm
data.value: This Organization Group does not have a Group ID, which is required for Workspace ONE Access setup. You can add the Group ID on the {0} page

data.name: RunAccInstaller
data.value: Run the AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) installer.

data.name: SeemsToBeSomeError
data.value: Server error occurred, please try after some time. If this issues persists, contact your IT administrator.

data.name: SetupCertificateAuthority
data.value: Follow these simple steps to automatically configure Mobile Single Sign-On using the AirWatch Certificate Authority. Click Continue to get started.

data.name: StartAccInstallShield
data.value: Start the AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) InstallShield Wizard.

data.name: StartAccInstallShieldInstruction1
data.value: 1. Log in to the server you will be using for the AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC).

data.name: StartAccInstallShieldInstruction2
data.value: 2. Transfer the AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) installer file to your server and then open it.

data.name: StartAccInstallShieldInstruction3
data.value: 3. When the Welcome screen appears, select Next.

data.name: StartAccInstallShieldInstruction4
data.value: 4. Accept the license agreement and then select Next.

data.name: StartAccInstallShieldInstruction5
data.value: 5. Select "Change..." to select the installation directory and then select Next.

data.name: StartAccInstallShieldInstruction6
data.value: 6. Enter the certificate password you created in Step 1 (prior to downloading the AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC) installer) then select Next.

data.name: TestConnectionToAccServer
data.value: Test the Connection to the AirWatch Cloud Connector (ACC)

data.name: vIDM
data.value: Workspace ONE Access

data.name: VidmCertificateDescription
data.value: Enable Workspace ONE UEM certificate provisioning for use with Workspace ONE Access and Mobile SSO. Export the issuer certificate on this page so that you can establish trust with Workspace ONE Access authentication adapters.

data.name: VidmConfigurationDescription
data.value: Establish trust between users, devices and the hybrid cloud for a seamless user experience and powerful conditional access to a unified app catalog with web, native and virtual apps.

data.name: VidmConnector
data.value: Workspace ONE Access Connector

data.name: VidmDescriptionText
data.value: Enable AirWatch certificate provisioning for use with Workspace ONE Access and mobile single sign-on. Export the issuer certificate on this page so that you can establish trust with Workspace ONE Access authentication adapters.

data.name: VidmInfoMessage
data.value: This will help you establish the connection between VMware Unified Endpoint Management and Workspace ONE Access.

data.name: VidmOverviewDescription
data.value: Once you’ve established communication between Workspace ONE Access and Unified Endpoint Management (UEM), you’ll be able to deploy:

data.name: VidmOverviewDescription1
data.value: A universal app catalog, including web, native and virtual apps

data.name: VidmOverviewDescription2
data.value: Mobile Single Sign-On (SSO)

data.name: VidmOverviewDescription3
data.value: Conditional access to applications, including device management and compliance

data.name: VidmOverviewDescription4
data.value: Mobile Flows

data.name: VidmOverviewDescription5
data.value: People Search

data.name: VidmOverviewHeader
data.value: Workspace ONE Access is the identity and access management component of Workspace ONE that provides users with single sign on and secure access to apps.

data.name: VidmOverviewImageInfo
data.value: Establish communication between Workspace ONE Access and VMware Unified Endpoint Management to manage identity-related components.

data.name: VidmPasswordRecoveryMessage
data.value: If you have forgotten your password, you can recover it on the {0} login page. If your password link has expired, please contact Workspace ONE UEM support.

data.name: VidmTenantAlreadyConfigured
data.value: Your Workspace ONE Access tenant has already been configured with another Workspace ONE UEM tenant or Organization Group. Go to Identity & Access Management > Setup > AirWatch to manually update your tenant with Workspace ONE UEM details. See page 14 of the {0} for details on how to configure.

data.name: VidmTestConnectionDesc
data.value: Test to confirm Workspace ONE UEM and Workspace ONE Access are communicating securely.

data.name: VmwareEnterpriseSystemsConnectorGuide
data.value: VMware Enterprise Systems Connector Guide

data.name: VmwareIdm
data.value: VMware Workspace ONE Access

data.name: WhyIsItImportant
data.value: Why is it important?
